item.description:
Described by The Times Literary Supplement as “the most significant English-language poet born since the second World War,” Paul Muldoon is the author of ten books of poetry, including the Pulitzer Prize-winning Moy Sand and Gravel, and, most recently, Horse Latitudes. Between 1999 and 2004, he was Professor of Poetry at Oxford University, an appointment that culminated in his publication of a work of literary criticism, The End of the Poem: Oxford Lectures. He teaches at Princeton University and is Poetry Editor of The New Yorker.

The Mildred F. Sawyer Library, located one block from the Park Street MBTA stop, is wheelchair accessible. Seating at the Poetry Center will be available on a first-come, first-served basis. Copies of Horse Latitudes and Moy Sand and Gravel will be on sale following the reading.

Free and open to the public.
item.name: Paul Muldoon at Suffolk
